title: Israel changes account of Gaza medic killings after video showed deadly attack
snippets: Israeli forces killed 15 emergency workers in a convoy of ambulances near Rafah on 23 March.
summary: On 23 March, Israeli forces killed 15 emergency workers in an attack on a convoy of ambulances near Rafah.
titles: Israel changes account of Gaza medic killings after video showed deadly attack

title: A Deadly Nazi Cult in Chile
snippets: How was a paedophilia and torture cult operating in plain sight in Chile for decades?
summary: In Chile, a paedophilia and torture cult operated undetected for decades due to a combination of factors, including societal indifference, systemic failures in law enforcement and child protection agencies, and the cult's ability to disguise its activities. The cult, exploiting vulnerabilities in the community and using manipulation to maintain secrecy, evaded scrutiny from authorities and the public. The situation came to light only after survivors began to speak out, prompting investigations that revealed the extent of the abuse and led to legal actions against those involved.
titles: A Deadly Nazi Cult in Chile

title: Pope Francis greets crowds at St Peter's Square
snippets: The Pope briefly appeared on stage in a wheelchair with an oxygen tube, two weeks after leaving hospital.
summary: The Pope made a brief appearance on stage in a wheelchair, equipped with an oxygen tube, marking his first public appearance two weeks following his discharge from the hospital.
titles: Pope Francis greets crowds at St Peter's Square

title: US cancels visas for South Sudanese over deportation dispute
snippets: The African nation is "taking advantage" of the US by not accepting its citizens, says the top US diplomat.
summary: The top US diplomat has accused an African nation of "taking advantage" of the United States by refusing to accept its citizens. This statement indicates a conflict or disagreement between the US and the unnamed African country over the repatriation of its nationals.
titles: US cancels visas for South Sudanese over deportation dispute

title: Zimbabwe to scrap tariffs on US goods as it faces 18% Trump levy
snippets: President Mnangawa says he wants improved relations, days after Donald Trump said the US would impose an 18% tariff on Zimbabwe.
summary: President Mnangawa of Zimbabwe expressed a desire for enhanced relations with the United States, just days following an announcement by Donald Trump that the US plans to impose an 18% tariff on imports from Zimbabwe. This statement by Mnangawa indicates a move towards diplomatic engagement amidst escalating economic tensions between the two countries.
titles: Zimbabwe to scrap tariffs on US goods as it faces 18% Trump levy

title: Best Final Four ... ever?! Breaking down Houston's, Florida's epic comebacks
snippets: The potentially historic Final Four more than delivered. Our analysts break down what they saw in San Antonio.
summary: The Final Four in San Antonio was a significant event that lived up to its historic potential, according to analysts. They provided detailed breakdowns of the games, highlighting key moments and performances.
titles: Best Final Four ... ever?! Breaking down Houston's, Florida's epic comebacks

title: What's next for Duke after Final Four loss? Three massive storylines for Jon Scheyer's busy offseason
snippets: It's time to start planning for life after Cooper Flagg in Durham
summary: The University of Durham is beginning preparations for the future following the departure of prominent figure Cooper Flagg. The focus is on adjusting and planning for the next phase without his involvement, indicating a significant transition for the institution.
titles: What's next for Duke after Final Four loss? Three massive storylines for Jon Scheyer's busy offseason

title: The secret to Houston's incredible comeback: Toughness and an ability to 'hang in there'
snippets: Though their season looked over, the Cougars stayed tough and found a way to pull out a miraculous win.
summary: The Cougars, despite facing challenges that made their season seem doomed, demonstrated resilience and achieved a surprising victory. This win marks a significant turnaround for the team, showcasing their determination and capability to overcome adversity.
titles: The secret to Houston's incredible comeback: Toughness and an ability to 'hang in there'

title: Comeback Cougars: Houston rallies, shocks Duke
snippets: Though Houston trailed throughout most of the game, J'Wan Roberts and his team stormed past Duke in the second half to book their trip to Monday's national title game with a 70-67 victory.
summary: Houston overcame a persistent deficit to defeat Duke 70-67 in a comeback victory at the Alamodome on Saturday night, securing their place in Monday's national title game. J'Wan Roberts played a key role in the team's second-half resurgence.
titles: Comeback Cougars: Houston rallies, shocks Duke

title: For Duke, stunned silence as title run collapses
snippets: A hush accompanied the Blue Devils' attempts to process how a six-point lead could disappear in less than 20 seconds Saturday night in a stunning 70-67 loss to Houston in the Final Four.
summary: The Blue Devils experienced a surprising defeat, losing 70-67 to Houston in the Final Four after their six-point lead vanished in under 20 seconds on Saturday night. This unexpected turn of events left the team and supporters in disbelief as they attempted to understand the rapid change in their fortunes.
titles: For Duke, stunned silence as title run collapses

title: A tariff crisis is exactly the right time to reform the WTO
snippets: The commitment to reaching decisions by consensus has led to paralysis
summary: The commitment to making decisions through consensus has resulted in a state of paralysis, where progress is halted due to the inability to reach unanimous agreement. This approach has effectively stalled action and decision-making processes.
titles: A tariff crisis is exactly the right time to reform the WTO

title: Tariffs spark US junk bond sell-off as recession risk mounts
snippets: Corporate credit is ‘the canary in the coal mine’ for a faltering economy, analysts warn
summary: Analysts have issued a warning that corporate credit is a critical indicator of a weakening economy, likening it to a "canary in the coal mine." This phrase suggests that problems in corporate credit markets could signal broader economic troubles ahead.
titles: Tariffs spark US junk bond sell-off as recession risk mounts

title: Trump and the long history of ‘sticky’ US tariffs
snippets: Past periods of protectionism suggest it is easier to start trade wars than end them
summary: Historical analysis shows that initiating trade wars is simpler than concluding them, indicating that once protectionist policies are implemented, reversing them can be challenging. This pattern suggests that trade conflicts can have prolonged durations and complex resolutions.
titles: Trump and the long history of ‘sticky’ US tariffs

title: Unite divided: British trade union grapples with twin scandals
snippets: Scrutiny of business ventures has led to allegations of conflicts of interest
summary: Investigations into various business ventures have raised allegations of conflicts of interest. These allegations suggest that individuals involved may have used their positions for personal gain, potentially compromising the integrity of the ventures. The current status of these allegations and the specifics of the conflicts of interest are under review.
titles: Unite divided: British trade union grapples with twin scandals

title: Why Trump’s tariffs won’t last long
snippets: Voter and business sentiment will pile pressure on the president’s agenda
summary: Growing voter dissatisfaction and business concerns are increasingly challenging the president's policy agenda. This mounting pressure reflects a significant shift in public and economic opinion, potentially influencing future policy directions and the administration’s ability to implement its plans.
titles: Why Trump’s tariffs won’t last long
